    public class Connect4
extends javafx.scene.layout.VBox

      Creates the button for closing the window.

      Creates a new disk and places it on the grid

      Creates the first row of buttons below the grid (play board) - these are the button to clear up the game message from the server and the message itself.

      Creates a label containing the result of the game
      private javafx.scene.shape.Shape createGrid()
      Creates the grid of the game (rectangle with holes in it)

      Creates a grid pane holding all the elements used to play the game (columns - x position, disk pane, ...)

      Creates a label holding a game message received from the server

      Creates the tile of the window.
      private void disableColumns()
      Disables all the columns (x positions) so the user can no longer click on it and play the game

      Cancels the game, meaning it disables all the columns (x positions), displays the appropriate message given as a parameter, etc.

        private void disableColumns()
        Disables all the columns (x positions) so the user can no longer click on it and play the game

      • gameCanceled

        public void gameCanceled(java.lang.String msg)
        Cancels the game, meaning it disables all the columns (x positions), displays the appropriate message given as a parameter, etc.
        Parameters:
        msg - message from the server that is going to be displayed

      • createDisk

        public void createDisk(int y,
                       int x,
                       boolean player1)
        Creates a new disk and places it on the grid
        Parameters:
        y - position y of the disk
        x - position x of the disk
        player1 - true/false which player placed the disk

        Returns:
        hBox holding the two buttons

      • createButtonCancelGame

        private javafx.scene.control.Button createButtonCancelGame()
        Creates the button for canceling the game. The game can be canceled on purpose. For example, when the user gets bored playing.
        Returns:
        cancel game button

      • colorWinningTails

        public void colorWinningTails(java.util.List<int[]> tails)
        Highlights the winning disks (tails) when the game is over.
        Parameters:
        tails - [y,x] positions of all the winning tiles

      • createButtonCloseWindow

        private javafx.scene.control.Button createButtonCloseWindow()
        Creates the button for closing the window. The user can click on this button as soon as the game is over.
        Returns:
        close window button

      • createFirstRowOfButtons

        private javafx.scene.layout.HBox createFirstRowOfButtons()
        Creates the first row of buttons below the grid (play board) - these are the button to clear up the game message from the server and the message itself.

        hBox containing these elements
